intro: Saccidium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating. Saccidium species produce small, greenish or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
